newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner broadens employee share offer.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner broadens employee share offer.

text.p: Dresdner Bank AG, Germany's second largest commercial bank, said on Friday it was extending its traditional employee share package this year by offering equity options to all staff, a first for a major German bank.

In a gesture to mark the bank's 125th anniversary, Dresdner staff will not only be offered shares at a 50 percent discount but can also acquire two options per employee share to buy Dresdner stock at one of three future dates.
Dresdner said this was the first time a large German bank had made such an offer to all staff, not just selected categories of employees.
"All employees will thus start to take note of Dresdner Bank's share price development and (this) will lead to a stronger identification with the company," Dresdner said.
Under the regular share offer scheme, Dresdner staff can buy up to 50 shares at 27.10 marks ($15.73) each. The bank's shares were trading at 55.90 marks in bourse dealings on Friday.
